title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
I have tried SMC reset and PRAm reset. Disconnected all connectors and tried for USB activity. None

No liquid damage, but it is quite dusty. A cheap charger was used before.

Advice on what to measure?

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
What is CPU core voltage after 10-15s?

Inspect for damage USB-C redriver chip.

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
CPUVR_SW1 - 0.96V
CPUVR_SW2 - 0.97V
SAVR_SW - 1.05V

Missing PPVCCGT_S0G_PH1/2/3
PPBUS_G3H_CPU - 13.01V
PPV_S0 - 5.1V
Something with U7100?

All other coils seem to be providing output. 

Nothing suspicious around CD32's 
[ATTACH type="full"]61030[/ATTACH]

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
Do not expect iGPU core voltgage (VCCGT) until high graphics load is detected.
Also, STOP checking DC voltage on input pins of the buck converter coils.

USB redriver chip is on the other side of the board.
We talked many times on the forum about it.
It doesn't appear in schematic/boardview...

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
PPVCCCPU_S0G - 0.96V
PPVCCSA_S0G - 1.04V
PPVCCIO_S0G - 0.95V

I can't see any short on the test pads in 500 range. Nor any damage around it
[ATTACH type="full"]61031[/ATTACH]

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message: Can I swap BIOS chip from another 00840?

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
Not recommended, is better to test with clean ME Bios.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1roFjzlTYrB0oRB5opnRaapdj7Rx2Zg7g/view?usp=share_link[/URL]

However, it should start (at least) with another chip from 00840 board.

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message: Flashed the bios. I get 20V 0.57A and feel the heat on the CPU but no keyboard or screen light. Fan spins moderately

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
What file did you use to flash it?
Check CPU core voltage after 10-15s.

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
820-00840 8HV22 Medusa clean ME + PRAM.bin file you have provided. I did erase + flash at once, which got stuck at 90% and had to interrupt. The second time I erased the flash first, then flashed and went straight forward. 

PPVCCCPU_S0G - 0.97V
PPVCCSA_S0G - 1.05V
PPVCCIO_S0G - 0.95V 

PPVCCPCH_S5G - 0V

title: A1708 820-00840 Turns on with no response from capslock, CPU getting hot and pulling 20v 0.45A
message:
Possibly bad CPU.
Just in case, heat with quality flux; to burn eventually accumulated crap.
